beer.beer_description:
Chestnut brown colour, light brown head. 
Scent: Hints of vanilla and of course chocolate. 

The predominant taste is chocolate and vanilla. Especially the fondant taste is very present on the palate. In the aftertaste the chocolate makes place for coriander and the curaçao that was used in the wheat beer.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 315 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower.

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 270 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 55!

You obviously are a big fan of Belgian Beer, and rightfully so! Three cheers to the great Belgian beers and their uniquely crafted flavors!

That's 135 different beers from Belgium. Try 5 more for Level 28.

user.bio: Beer beer and fuck it let's have more beer

Travel and beer.
CAMRA member West Suffolk and Borders.
Beer is anywhere between 95-98% water, which means it’s 95-98% good for you.

Donated $3k to Ukraine so far
Trying to visit all Oregon breweries in 1 year to raise money and awareness
Let me know if
Yorkshireman, CAMRA Member and Cask & Craft beer drinker!

items.checkin_comment: Looks far. Slightly overaromatic. Spicy and fruity. Light body. Little to no bitterness. One is enough.
